family_experience.description: The Crosstrail is a light and fast fitness machine that handles a wide range of terrain. It’s the perfect setup for a weekend adventure ride on gravel trails, fire roads, paved pathways and everything in between. It’s your workout companion, but also offers great versatility to turn into a fast commuter bike, on and off-road.

rider_benefits.rider_benefit: Lightweight M4 and A1 frames for stable handling at on-road and off-road speeds
Geometry is designed for the perfect balance of confidence and speed
Fast rolling Specialized Trigger 700x38c tyres combine minimal rolling resistance with off-road grip
Legitimate, reliable off-road capability via double-wall rims and cassette hubs on all bikes
Custom suspension fork with integrated crown creates sleek downtube design while still utilising standard internal parts; lockout for efficient climbing performance

features.what1: WHAT: Wide range SRAM WiFLi 10-speed 11-36 rear cassette combined with new 48/32 double chainrings.
features.why1: WHY: Eliminates cross shifting and complexity of a triple chainring but offers equal gear range.
features.how1: HOW: Utilising SRAM 2x10 WiFLi technology combined with a custom 48/32 tooth front crankset.
features.what2: WHAT: Custom suspension fork with integrated crown design. Remote lockout function from the handlebar (select models).
features.why2: WHY: Integrated crown design for more integrated front and sleeker, straighter downtube.
features.how2: HOW: Proprietary, custom designed suspension fork crown enables a unique downtube, headtube and fork crown unit. With a lockout, riders gain more efficiency on any surface.
features.what3: WHAT: Lightweight, fully butted, smooth welded M4 Premium Aluminium tubing.
features.why3: WHY: M4 aluminium tubing creates the best balance of weight, strength, and compliance.
features.how3: HOW: By controlling everything from the raw material to the extrusion, butting, swaging and heat treatment of the tubes we can optimise our Crosstrail frame for an extreme light and stiff all-road experience.
features.what4: WHAT: Front and rear derailleur cables are routed inside the frame.
features.why4: WHY: To achieve a sleek look by keeping the bike clutter free, plus to keep gunk out of the cables. It’s a win-win situation!
features.how4: HOW: The cables enter the frame at the top of the downtube and exit at the bottom bracket.
